description: trans- +â€Ž human, also attested as trans-human in the 1950s. Attributed to Teilhard de Chardin, as French trans-humain (noun, sometimes capitalised as (le) Trans-humain), who used it alongside ultra-humain ("the ultra-human"). As a countable English noun (plural transhumans) introduced by  F. M. Esfandiary in the 1960s (here trans- is short for transitional).

adjectives.description: transhuman (comparative more transhuman, superlative most transhuman)

entries.meaning: Involving something beyond the merely human; transcending human limitations or boundaries.
(countable) An enhanced human; An individual having characteristics transitional between a human and a posthuman species.
A being that transcends humanity; a superhuman being.
